casebody.data:
Jacob Bookman, Respondent v. The New York Elevated Railroad Company, et al., Appellants. Decided January 11, 1892. Appeal by defendants from judgment entered upon decision by a judge after trial at special term. Davies & Rapallo, attorneys, and Edward B. Thomas of counsel, for appellants. William G. Peckham, attorney, and E. W. Tyler of counsel, for respondent.

Before Freedman, P. J., McAdam and Gildersleeve, JJ.

Opinion by McAdam, J.; Freedman, P. J., and Gildersleeve, J., concurred.

Judgment affirmed, with costs.
